DOC.brief_summary: The objective study intra-individually compare performance two pacemaker algorithm design reduce unnecessary right ventricular pacing : Intrinsic Rhythm Support Plus ( IRSplus ) Ventricular Pace Suppression ( VpS ) . The study compare ventricular pacing percentage , long-term atrio-ventricular conduction time , occurrence atrial tachyarrhythmic event atrial fibrillation burden percentage patient implanted pacemaker Sick Sinus Syndrome .
DOC.brief_title: Ventricular Pace Suppression Versus Intrinsic Rhythm Support Study
DOC.criteria: Patients 18 year age ; Patient proven inform consent ; Subject indication dual chamber pacemaker due Sinus Node Dysfunction ; Subjects dual chamber pacemaker already implant within six month enrollment , provide ventricular pacing percentage ≤ 40 % right ventricular lead apical position ; Stable medical situation ; Stable geographical situation ; Permanent paroxysmal AV block ≥ II ; Permanent Atrial fibrillation/Atrial flutter ; Device Replacement ; Patient poor echocardiographic window ; Patient already implant right ventricular lead apical position ; Subjects dual chamber pacemaker , implant later six month ; Subjects dual chamber pacemaker ventricular pacing percentage ≥ 40 % ; Contraindication DDD ( R ) ADI ( R ) DDD ( R ) pace mode ; VpS IRSplus algorithm contraindication ; Age < 18 year ; Life expectancy < 12 month ; Cardiac surgery plan within FU period ; Participation another clinical investigation ;
